page.title: 09Geese & horses: SW.Cheshire.
page.content: {GEESE.}On Chester Road,Gatesheath,is a farm producing goslings for sale,a day old bird costing 3 pounds.To produce the eggs about 100 geese are kept in wire fenced pens by day & in good quality wooden sheds at night.This requires only part-time labour.The young birds are sold through adverts & also by reputation,there being little passing trade,although occasionally an egg is sold for craftwork(eg.for decoration in a Faberge style). {HORSES.}The 21 acres of land on Oak Farm have been sold for a livery stable for around 15 horses.In a field adjacent to the stables are a considerable number of practise horse jumps.There are also at least 2 horses kept in a paddock & stables at a large expensive house (built in the 1970's) on the road to Hatton House.Horses are for recreation not farm work.
